note.p: Birth: Finch Lane, Cornhill, London, England (07 March 1818)
Death: 1A Hyde Park Gate, London (30 November 1903)

Career: Trained as an engineer and studied steam propulsion; constructed a locomotive for the Stockton and Darlington Railway (1843); set up his own business concentrating legal and consultative work (1853); the first engineer to practise as a technical advocate; President, British Association (1888); Adviser to the London water companies; died of a cerebral haemorrhage
